DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Study Site Research Personnel Role Role Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A researcher at a study site who oversees multiple aspects of the study at a site, including protocol submission for IRB approval, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, and analysis. The coded value specifying a type of responsibility of the study site personnel. EXAMPLE(S): Principal Investigator, Sub Investigator, Facility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Study Site Research Personnel Role Role Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:People engaged in research.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event._The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.:A system, often of numbered categories, used for representation of data.
